de.lessvoid.nifty.spi.node

Interface NiftyLayoutReceiver<T extends NiftyNode>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    NiftyNodeImpl<T>

    public interface NiftyLayoutReceiver<T extends NiftyNode>
extends NiftyNodeImpl<T>
    This interface defines a node that is able to receive layout data from outer layout nodes.

    The node implementing his class will receive the arrangement rectangle of the first layout node in the tree above this node. It will not be subject to the layout operations normally performed by the outer node. That means that the stack layout applied by a StackLayoutNode will not effect a layout receiver that is located directly below this node. Instead it will receive the arrangement rectangle that was applied to his StackLayoutNode, means it will cover the same space as the StackLayoutNode itself.

    If you want to apply the layout operation of the StackLayoutNode to the receiver you have to place a additional layout node in the tree between so the layout node is able to receive the data. Most of the time a SimpleLayoutNode is a good candidate for that task.

    Author:
    Martin Karing <nitram@illarion.org>
